Hi Gordon,
               Thanks for your reply. A couple more questions.
 =

1. In Hertrix 2.x is there a plan to use Java NIO  (asynchronous I/O) 
in =
Toe-Threads to improve the performance and scalability
of Heritrix for very=
 large web crawls ?
 
2. How is politeness taken care of in Heritrix cluste=
r configuration ?
   Since 2 or more nodes in the cluster could be hitting =
the same server
   without knowing that they are potentially violating poli=
tenss.
 
Thanks
-Ankur
 

________________________________

From: archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf O=
f Gordon Mohr
Sent: Friday, November 16, 2007 4:14 AM
To: archive-crawler@y=
ahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Discovered URI in Crawl log

=


Goel, Ankur wrote:
> 
> Hi,
> In the crawl logs I am seeing an unknown le=
gend 'P'
> in the discovered URI path. the known legends as per user
> manu=
al are
> R - Redirect
> E - Embed
> X - extracted
> L - Link
> 
> Can anyon=
e tell me what 'P' means?

Hi, Ankur -

'P' is 'Prerequisite' -- a URI whos=
e scheduling was triggered because it

was needed before completing another=
 URI (which appears in the 'P' log 
line's 'via' field).

Also, 'X' is spec=
ifically for a 'speculative' extraction that is unsure 
of whether the link=
 is more like an 'E'mbed (necessary to render the 
page) or an navigational=
 out'L'ink (an optional path for the viewer to 
follow). 'X's usually come =
from Javascript or other non-HTML media, and 
are treated as 'E'mbeds to er=
r on the side of inclusion -- but not 
necessarily followed transitively as=
 many hops as a certain 'E'mbed.

I've added a line about 'P' to the user-m=
anual glossary. The updated 
version should appear on the website shortly.
=

- Gordon @ IA



 

------_=_NextPart_001_01C82AAD.BC691E28
